definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Mila Kolesnikova is a Moscow actress and photo journalist.
sentences.chinese: 米拉，莫斯科的演員和攝影記者。

sentences.english: The photojournalist’s job may be history before long.
sentences.chinese: 專業攝影記者的工作已經有很長的歷史。

sentences.english: One of the photographers threw stones at the settlers.
sentences.chinese: 錄像上，一名攝影記者向定居者投擲石塊。

sentences.english: Press photographers get close-ups of the Oscar telecast model.
sentences.chinese: 媒體攝影記者湊近了拍奧斯卡電視直播的舞臺模型。

sentences.english: And number 4, I think, was photo journalists.
The cameraman and numerous pilots are gunned down by the Zeros twice.
sentences.chinese: 那個攝影記者和幾名飛行員被零式飛機打倒兩次。

sentences.english: The Associated Press sent a photographer to capture the chicken's many moods.
sentences.chinese: 美聯社則派了一名攝影記者前來抓拍小雞的各種表情。

sentences.english: Photographers are sent to take the pictures.
sentences.chinese: 於是派攝影記者去拍照。

sentences.english: She scuffled with photographers as she left her hotel.
sentences.chinese: 在離開所住的旅館時，她和一些攝影記者發生了衝突。

sentences.english: The newsreel people were there, taking pictures of the picket .
sentences.chinese: 新聞攝影記者也在那兒，給糾察隊拍照。

sentences.english: The age of flashbulb photography and celebrities in the front row.
sentences.chinese: 攝影記者和名人坐在了前排。
他是一名出色的攝影記者。

definition: chief editor (of newspaper)/abbr. for 總編輯|总编辑
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
variant of 弗吉尼亞州|弗吉尼亚州/Virginia, US state
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
